alert.note: Alert for Mason (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 31 at 12:17AM PDT until October 31 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Seattle WA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Washington... Skokomish River At Potlatch affecting Mason County. .An atmospheric river will continue to bring heavy rainfall to the area through Monday morning. This is expected to push the Skokomish River above flood stage early this morning through most of Monday. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Skokomish River At Potlatch. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 16.5 feet, the Skokomish River will cause widespread flooding of pasture lands, with water flowing quickly over West Bourgault Road and Skokomish Valley Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 AM PDT Monday the stage was 16.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early this morning to a crest of 16.8 feet late this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 16.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this morning at 1145 AM PDT.
